gene.function: FUNCTION: Hydrolase that deubiquitinates monoubiquitinated target proteins such as histone H2A and H2B. Required for proper progression through S phase and subsequent mitotic entry. May regulate the DNA damage response (DDR) checkpoint through deubiquitination of H2A at DNA damage sites. Associates with the chromatin. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:17980597}.
gene.subcellularLocation: SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Nucleus {ECO:0000269|PubMed:17980597}. Note=Localizes preferentially with monoubiquitinated H2A to chromatin.
geneOntologyBiologicalProcess: negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II [GO:0000122]
geneOntologyMolecularFunction: RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding [GO:0000978]
